verses.verse: {God the Creator and Redeemer} d "Listen to this, house of Jacob, you who are called by the name of Israel, and who have come forth from Judah's loins; {Lit. waters ; this word is misspelled in both 1QIsa a and MT} you who swear oaths in the name of the Lord and invoke the God of Israel but not in truth, nor in good faith.
For they name themselves after the holy city, and rely on the God of Israel the Lord of the Heavenly Armies is his name.
I foretold the former things long ago; it {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read they} went forth from my mouth, and I disclosed them; Suddenly, I acted, and they came to pass.
Because I knew {Lit. Because of my knowledge} that you are obstinate, and because your neck is an iron sinew, and your forehead is bronze,

I told you these things long ago; I announced them to you before they happened so that you couldn't say, «My idol did them; my {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads and my} carved image or metal idol ordained them.'
"You have heard now look at them all! How {Lit. And how} can you not admit them? From now on, I'll make you hear new things, hidden things that you have not known.
They are created now, and not long ago; you didn't hear them before today, so you cannot say, «Yes, I knew them.'

And {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa b MT LXX lack And} neither had you heard, nor did you understand, nor did you open {So 1QIsa a Targ; MT reads did your ear open itself ; CaiGen Syr Vulg read was your ear uncovered} your ear long ago. {Lit. ear from of old} Indeed, I knew that {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lacks that} you would act very deceitfully, and they would call {So 1QIsa a ; LXX Targ read and you would be called ; 4QIsa d MT read deceitfully, calling} you a rebel from birth.

I defer my anger for my name's sake, and as my first act {Lit. and for my commencement ; or and for my profanation ; so 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa d MT read for my praise ; LXX reads for my glorious deeds} I'm restraining it for you, so as not to cut you off.
Look, I have refined you, but not like silver; I have purified {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read chosen} you in the furnace of affliction.

For my own sake Yes, for my own sake! I'm doing it; indeed, how can I be profaned? {Or can I wait ; so 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa d MT read can it be profaned ; 4QIsa d MT read can it wait ; LXX reads can my name be profaned} Furthermore, I won't give my glory to another."

{The Lord Calls Israel} d "Listen to these things, {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read me} Jacob, and Israel, whom I have called. I am the One: I am the first, I am even {So 1QIsa a MT; 4QIsa d reads also} the last.

Moreover, my hands laid {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read hand laid} the earth's foundation, and my right hand spread out the heavens. I call out to them, and {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa c 4QIsa d LXX; MT lacks and} they stand up together.

Let all of them come together and listen: {So 1QIsa a LXX; 4QIsa d MT read Come together, all of you, and listen!} Who is there among them that could declare {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa d MT LXX read has declared} these things? "The Lord loves me, {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa d MT read him ; LXX reads you} and he will accomplish {So 1QIsa a (misspelling carry out ); 4QIsa d MT read He will carry out ; LXX reads I have carried out} my purpose {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa d MT LXX ms read his purpose ; LXX reads your purpose} against Babylon; his arm {I. e. the Messiah; so 1QIsa a ; MT reads and his arm ; LXX reads to do away with the offspring} will be against the Chaldeans.

I Yes, I! have spoken; indeed, I've called and {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa d MT read called him ; 4QIsa c LXX read brought him} I've brought him, and he will make his path successful. {Or his path will be successful ; so 1QIsa a (feminine) and 4QIsa d MT (masculine); 4QIsa c LXX read I will make his path successful}

Draw near to me, and {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lacks and} listen to this: «From the beginning I haven't spoken in secret; at {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads from} the time it happened, I was there.'And now the Lord God, and his Spirit, has sent me. {Or has sent me and his Spirit .}

"This is what the Lord says, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: "I am the Lord your God, who teaches you how to succeed, who directs you {1QIsa a misspells this word} in the path by which {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b 4QIsa c 4QIsa d MT lack which} you should go.
Now {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b 4QIsa c LXX; MT lacks Now} if only you had paid attention to my commandments! Then your peace would have been like a river, and your success like the waves of the sea.

Your descendants would've been like the sand, and your offspring {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX read the offspring of your loins} like its numberless grains. Their name wouldn't have been cut off or annihilated out of my reach.

"Go out from Babylon, flee from the Chaldeans! With happy shouts, announce and {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT lack and} proclaim this {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b 4QIsa d MT LXX read this. Send it forth} to the ends {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa d MT LXX read end} of the earth: Say, «The Lord has redeemed his servant Jacob!'

They didn't thirst when he led him {So 1QIsa a LXX mss ; 4QIsa d MT LXX read them} through the desolate places. He made water gush {So 1QIsa a Syr; cf. Ps 78:20 and 105:41; 1QIsa b 4QIsa d MT read flow; LXX reads he will bring forth} from a rock for them; he split open the rock, and water gushed out.
"But {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX lack But} there is no peace,"says the Lord , "for the wicked."
